comments.author: Cyrus Fx

comments.text:
It's admirable that you're trying but what you seem to be trying is 
basically patching a terminally broken system. It just wont work. Even when 
this amendment you propose is passed the legislators will just find another 
way of flasking yous. The problem is not in these bribes but in the system 
of representative democracy itself. A representative can never truly 
represent hir constituency, at best a majority. The entire system of 
representative democracy can and will never provide happiness across the 
board because there will always be groups that are completely ignored. We 
(on all continents and in all countries) need to look for solutions that 
work and that's not dictatorships, that's not monarchies, and that's not 
representative democracies. These systems are essentially the same in that 
a small group at the top tell everyone else what to do and how to think; 
the only difference between representative democracies and the others is 
that representative democracies make a change of face easier. What we need 
is a bottom-up approach to managing our affairs, not a top-down one.﻿
comments.author: Hadrian Ferran

comments.text:
+Frank Sacksen Did you even read what I wrote?  You truly must be a low 
life.  
I'll put it in simple terms.  When men do NOT govern themselves, they 
infringe on the basic human rights of those around them.  And you seem to 
think that men will self-govern.  *Genius*  Why didn't we think of that.
You seem to think that everything is a simple result of supply and demand. 
 Take human trafficking for example.  The demand is men wanting sex.  The 
supply is women willing to have sex.  Yet, instead of men treating other 
human beings with respect and governing themselves, men forcefully steal 
young women and then sell them so that they can supply the demand of the 
sex trade.
Where does your voluntarism work?  Who is going to volunteer to challenge 
with their time and money to eradicate prostitution and slavery?  

Why do I believe roads would be different? How about standards. When the 
railroad industry didn't have any standards, almost every set of tracks was 
made to the owner's specifications, meaning that that trains weren't 
compatible with multiple tracks.  Eventually standards were written to 
coordinate tracks to be common sizes.
Roads are the same way.  If you don't have standards on everything from 
width to material to speeds (ranges), you'd be driving along and every area 
would change the way they would build, maintain and replace their roads. 
 Land owners would place tolls when you came near their property.

Law Enforcement becoming goon squads?  Look at Chicago, Illinois, New York, 
etc.  It's hard enough to prevent corruption in law enforcement, now you 
want to make it where people pay for private security.  What about those 
people who can't afford it?  Yeah, they're screwed.  You think that's okay.

Fallacies?  You don't even know the meaning of the word.  

Democracy has provided more to help eliminate those problems than 
voluntarism ever has.
comments.author: mfgman2011

The points I offered are there because we have history to look back upon

As men who have a desire to rule over other men achieve those goals, they

In order for a government to not be required, men must be self-governed,

the lazy man will plunder.  

What you propose is a system that ultimately would promote crime and 
require a society to move back to a republic in which we elect men and

Where are society has failed is in being informed and active in pushing 
back as a people against our government.

Retarded?  Clueless?  Hardly.
What have you done with your life?  Are you a loving father?  Loving 
husband of 1 wife?  Do you have multiple degrees and produce inventions 
that affect the lives of the people around you positively?  Do you serve 
your fellow man?  

"Discrimination is a good thing." - Frank Sacksen  

What a telling statement.  You have no clue the level of stupidity you have 
revealed in yourself.

comments.author: Frank Sacksen

comments.text:
+Frank Sacksen I beg to differ but I appreciate your expert criticism about 
my cluelessness.**  If you want to compare brainwaves, you can troll 
someone else.  
As far as the use of the word "morally" rather than ethics.  I 
intentionally chose the word.  Even our founding fathers used the word 
moral when discussing laws.  It sounds like you are either misusing the 
term yourself, i.e. "consequence of bad moral" (should be plural, i.e. 
morals) because it reads as if you are trying to saying "morale" which is a 
completely different subject.

But criticize me...ok.

But the truth remains.  Unless a law exists to outlaw an activity, that 
activity is legal.

For example, if we didn't have a law stating that rape was illegal, then 
rape would not be prosecutable as an offense.

As I've said before, I understand your view.  I'm simply stating that it's 
fundamentally flawed and has not worked in the real world at the level you 
propose.

But good luck man.  Eliminate all government.  Woot!  Who's gonna maintain 
the roads?  Who's gonna ensure that personally paid for law enforcement 
agencies don't turn into goo squads?  Who's gonna make sure that employers 
provide equitable benefits for employees?  Who's gonna make sure that 
people aren't discriminated against in the workplace?  

Or does your view of voluntarism say that all that stuff is ok?
comments.author: mfgman2011

comments.text:
+mfgman2011 We don't need a single law to get support against theft and 
coercion. NOT A SINGLE ONE!

You are obviously clueless and you unveil this by saying: "no activity is 
illegal, regardless of how morally wrong".

In this context the laws totally overlap moral as in reality as it is now. 
The moral of legalized theft against innocent people. Legalized coercion 
against they who didn't produce any victim is a consequence of bad moral. 
The laws are there only to enforce the bad moral. The word you were looking 
for is ETHICS. The ethics dictates no legalized theft and no legalized 
coercion as a consequence of logical necessity. Ethics needs to be 
consistent. Under ethics you cannot allow yourself to permit an action for 
the mob, but forbid it for the individual.
comments.author: Frank Sacksen

comments.text:
+Frank Sacksen I understand your premise.  My point was that without a law, 
no activity is illegal, regardless of how morally wrong it may be.
I very much support the reduction of laws and government altogether.  
The question then becomes, if you know something is wrong, what laws will 
you pass in order to establish it as illegal, and thus have a punishment.
Beyond that, WHO will enforce the law?  Both the prevention of the crime 
and the enforcement of the penalty?  To answer your question, NO.  And 
furthermore, taxes are NOT the only way crime is being fought in this 
country.

But it sounds to me like you would rather say that people should volunteer 
to pay for those services and/or volunteer their time to serve in those 
areas and that is it.
Both premises are without any truth and stem from a Utopian mindset.

In reality, people will only involved themselves financially if they feel 
compelled to do so based upon a variety of reasons, such as personal 
relevance, relational impact, personal business interests, potential 
profitability, personal moral convictions, etc.

Volunteerism would ultimately lead to a form of Oligarchy or feudal society 
as those who are more determined to lead/rule than others would rise in 
business and essentially enslave their fellow man without any government 
oversight.  
This IS the reason for anti-trust laws.  

Like I said, I agree with you to a point, but I recognize that to eliminate 
government altogether would lead to a collapse of basic human 
rights...returning us to eras of darkness.

accountable?
I'm in agreement with you in regards to reducing legislation, but to 
eliminate it all would lead to anarchy which is a fool's ideal.  It would 
only work in a society in which 100% of all people shared the same ideals 
and they never interacted for trade, business, etc.  
So congratulations, society will instantly either devolve into crime, or 
all progress, development, higher learning, etc. would halt as we know it.

comments.author: mfgman2011

comments.text:
First of all, I know not a single anarchist who doesn't vehemently oppose 
genital mutilation. They may exist but, if so, I don't want to know them.

Second of all, many differences in production stem from differences in 
environmental and historical conditions. When a farmer has only half the 
produce compared to another because the soil is less fertile or gets less 
rain is it hir fault?

Third of all, Socialism as a word means very little today as everyone from 
neoliberals to revolutionary Anarchists use the term. State-Socialism, as 
you are most familiar with from your Ukrainian history, can just as well be 
called State-Capitalism as the means of production, in that case, are still 
not in the hands of the working class. It is just as far from Communism as 
normal Capitalism, maybe even farther.

Fourth of all, I vehemently oppose the idea that I or anyone else can 
"mechanically direct the 'animal spirits' of humans in a useful Socialist 
direction." This Marxist-Leninist dogma has only led to horrors such as the 
many crimes against humanity of Stalin, Mao, and the Kim family. I believe 
humans are naturally already capable of voluntary co-operation and mutual 
aid. I believe that my only role, as an Anarchist, is to let people know 
that there are other ideas next to neo-liberalism. Basically it comes close 
to the saying: "One can lead a horse to water but one can't make hir 
drink." Marxist-Leninist dogma (and the ideologies derived from it such as 
Stalinism) think that you need to force the horse to water and then push 
his head into the water, if the horse resists to much you shoot hir. I, and 
other Anarchists I know and have read, believe that we can lead the horse 
to water but that the horse has to make hir own decision.

About states, I believe that states will always become corrupt but, more 
importantly, that they have corrupted society. I believe Humanity can do 
without an organization which constantly forces us to do and think what it 
wants us to do and think. Instead, I believe Humans have the natural 
capacity to come together in voluntary organization in order to solve 
problems.

Another thing, Communism means the abolition of money as a whole. The 
guiding idea is "to produce as you can and take what you need." There 
should be a minor addendum into this rule as we have gained the technology 
to produce way more than we (the entire Human species) need. Nevertheless, 
this doctrine epitomizes an understanding of objective differences in 
humans. I, at this moment, do not need insulin-injections to survive and 
thus do not need to take it. Others do and are, under this Communist ideal, 
allowed to take as much insulin as they need. This doesn't mean that I 
should be forced to take an insulin shot in order to force some kind of 
equality.

To continue on production, I already stated that we have gained the 
technological capacity to produce more than the Human species need. The 
needs of the Human species are however, at the moment, artificially 
inflated because of the consumerist society. Cell phones which should be 
able to be used for a decade are discarded practically from the box. Cars 
are often replaced within about three years even though they can still 
drive for hundreds of thousands of kilometres. Moreover, many consumer 
goods are designed with planned obsolescence. Take away this consumerism 
which has been artificially and carefully created over the past century and 
we can live with relatively little labour per person. Many Anarchists 
believe that, instead of forcing people into a hyper-regimented lifestyle 
as now, our labour should be a form of creative play. This is what I 
consider to be socialized labour, where we have control over the means of 
production ourselves and perform our labour not as a chore but as a social 
process with others. Something that is made virtually impossible in modern 
society.

In short, you have assumed that I want enforced equality through wages 
whereas I want to abolish wages altogether and embrace a Communist society. 
You have assumed that I want to force people into this society whereas I 
believe people need to reach conclusions about society on their own and I 
can only show them that these ideologies exist. It is fine with me if some 
groups decide to go for Mutualism (see Proudhon), others for Collectivism 
(see Bakunin), yet others for Communism (see Kropotkin), and yet others for 
another variety as yet unimagined. The most important thing is that a 
change in social and societal relations is absolutely necessary because 
Capitalism and the States are only bringing us misery. You mentioned you 
are from the Ukraine, from what I gathered one of the factors in the 
current turmoil was a trade-agreement that the EU was forcing onto the 
country. This is absolutely necessary for Capitalism to lengthen its 
lifetime because European and American Capital needs to be dumped 
elsewhere. These, and similar acts by the EU/USA are very close to what 
happened in the Scramble for Africa. The necessity of Capital to dump its 
overflow was already noted by Marx in Capital.

PS. I have mentioned several times that other Anarchists have similar views 
on certain topics. I must note that I cannot speak for other Anarchists and 
can only explain that certain viewpoints are also held by others within the 
movement. Anarchism is, however, too broad for me to authoritatively speak 
about any official dogmas or party lines because they simply don't exist. 
There are about as many Anarchisms as there are Anarchists. The only thing 
that defines all Anarchists is a belief that the State must be abolished.
comments.author: Hadrian Ferran

comments.text:
+Hadrian Ferran
 Well this is exactly true. I have taken objective differences and make 
them subjectively important, because that is my prerogative. Facts are 
facts, unless you can use Leftist logic and convolute them with 
anti-rationalism.
 
Indeed that is exactly what you have committed! You believe that one hour 
of my life is worth one hour of your life. What is the criteria? As two 
human beings, this is true pertaining to their human value. I am not worth 
more than you. It is why Conservatives scream about the mutilation of, or 
the abuse of, young Muslim girls while relativist Leftists are silent. They 
do not deal in the value of life or the individual, but instead equivocate 
the idea, the ideology, the religion as equal. I am not interested in what 
anyone thinks their work is worth. I worry about their value as an 
individual. Leftists do this with minimum wage. Well if that entry level 
training job is now the normal life-style or career, and their work is 
worth $15/hour, then what is the value of the time of someone who 
previously made $15/hour? Or the person who made $20? In the Soviet Union 
we all made $20 a month, though our efforts were not equal. Our mental 
abilities were not equal. Every citizen knew this phrase: “I will pretend 
to work as long as you pretend to pay me!” I think the American version you 
aspire to would be: “I will pretend to work, as long as you are willing to 
pay me anyway!” Why? Because how do you assure equal effort, even when 
accepting different results?
 
Putin may work harder than Prime Minister Harper, but the value and intent 
of their work is completely different, rendering this egalitarian 
perspective of equal work as a total fallacy. Two people are farmers. One 
produces twice as much food. This farmer feeds twice as many people. Yet 
one is inefficient and makes bad choices about seed, planting, and 
fertilizer. The first plants after a large rain and produces more. His 
choices have benefited not only himself but mankind in general, unless you 
are a liberal eugenicist like John Holdren of course. Perhaps his 
initiative will influence observers in the next season? But you would have 
me perceive their effort as equal. If George Bush and Barack Obama put in 
equal hours, which is far from true, would you perceive them equals 
politically or in measuring your accepted social results? Now we have two 
scientists, one of whom creates a cure for ebola. He has devoted 10,000 
hours of research to find a cure. Another scientist devotes 10,000 hours to 
finding a higher impact plastic explosive. Hey, as you said, equal value, 
equal gain for their common effort.
 
“So we both have equal ability to make decisions over that body”? And what 
of two people, one who has never smoked, and one who smokes six packs a 
day? Were their abilities to “choose” equal? Should they be guaranteed 
equal results? Maybe the government can do it for them? Natural Authority! 
Yes, I believe in it. But natural authority gives us that equal right to 
choose, not to be led. You seem to perceive natural authority for equal 
results.
 
Your foundation for egalitarianism is contrived from your need to validate 
your ideology. You don’t like the outcome, so you will prove the process is 
unfair! That reminds me of Michael Mann, Maurice Strong, and Dr. Phil Jones 
in the Hockey Stick Theory. Mann had a theory and he was going to prove it 
was right! He measured tree rings. He theorized the earth had warmed 0.01 
degrees per year for 150 years. The tree rings and temps didn’t match so 
they destroyed the data at East Anglia and faked data. Well in truth it 
wasn’t necessary. Their research showed no data for precipitation and 
hydrology! Perhaps then, though I am not assured, they could have proved 
their point if they had followed the Scientific Theory.
 
Children of a lesser god! I ask you to set aside the relativist perspective 
for a moment. I would ask you is it fair that a young lady is born into a 
Muslim family in north Africa that mutilates her genitals and sells her for 
a camel? Then you have a spoiled brat in America born with a silver spoon? 
What natural authority does the Muslim girl have, and will that 
circumstance determine her fate at all, rather than her natural authority? 
Life is not fair, and government can’t make it fair. And in my opinion when 
something is given cheaply, like a trophy for participation, or money for 
sitting on your ass, you have cheapened the soul to the point where that 
hour of labor or effort become irrelevant. I have lived much of my life in 
Ukraine, Melitopol, Zaporozhye Oblast not far very from Donetsk. We know 
well that Socialism does not raise the basement, it crashes the ceiling. As 
a result, egalitarianism is achieved. That being equal misery. There is no 
other outcome. And the evidence is universal and all around. That is 
empirical evidence. When one disqualifies reason for emotive 
anti-rationalism, you are not a sociologist as Emile Durkheim and Marx 
pretended to be. Instead they are a Michael Mann, with a set of mental 
tools defying that natural authority of mankind.
 
You would have me believe the pie is static in size. If so, why do people 
ever have more luxury, better health conditions, well until people who are 
born to a lesser god come here to participate in the spoils of Capitalism 
without a thought to the oppressive rich! Maybe our evil system can cure 
their scabies, tuberculosis, and ebola? What I do not accept is the same 
thing you hold in contempt, that being a government which cheats, and can 
be bought by any special interest. Isn’t that what happened when the Health 
Insurance Industry was first castigated, threatened, and then brought into 
the White House for a special deal, that being increased previously “evil” 
profits from the new AFA healthcare bill? Suddenly they were compliant, 
just as Mussolini predicted in 1922. That is the evil of government, and it 
is not unique to one party or one ideology. It is systemic! And you vote it 
out, you adhere to the Constitution, and return powers to the State rather 
than fulfill Wilson’s dream of centralized control which as Mussolini 
predicted, would afford him corruption. Is it any wonder that the “un 
fasci” were the 3 communist labor unions in Italy circa 1908? Yes it 
eventually morphed into Fascism instead of communism, but before then they 
were known as “the syndicate”, after the syndicalist labor movement. Soon 
post 1915 that name laterally became the nickname of the Mafia. Why would 
that be?
 
We have two different perspectives. You believe in a more robust Elitist 
perspective that you, a great man among lesser men, can mechanically direct 
the “animal spirits” of humans in a useful Socialist direction. I like, 
Ivan Pavlov, do not consider human beings to be trained dogs. This 
Administration does!

This is my last post. I don't have time. I have two capitalist jobs.
comments.author: Quasimoto44

comments.text:
You have made a vital mistake in your reasoning. You have taken objective 
differences and made them subjectively important when they are not. When 
you work for one hour and I work for one hour one of us may have produced 
more than the other but the fact of the matter is that we still both worked 
for one hour and have lost one hour of our lives.

Moreover, we both have a body and although it is different in outward 
appearance and, probably, inward repair the fact is that we both have equal 
ability to make decisions over that body. This ability is called natural 
authority and the natural authority of each person is the same as that of 
any other. In this, too, we are equal.

Finally, you quoted Marx but I get the idea you never really read Capital 
after all as it should be clear to you that no Capitalist has gained hir 
wealth honestly. Every Capitalist has stolen hir wealth, this is inherent 
to the system.

Finally, government is always the lackey of the Capitalist. It's entire 
raison d'être is to protect private property and to deny the basic rights 
to one group of people in favour of another group of people. As many have 
noted, the greatest tragedy in history was when one person denied another 
(starving) person the right to use the land and got away with it.
comments.author: Hadrian Ferran

comments.text:
+Hadrian Ferran
That would infer that your ideals are better than another's ideals. I don't 
accept the Left's "greater moral world view". I think government exists to 
create a fair playing field, and I think that the TRUE fascist definition 
creates oppression and unfair inequality. You perceive "equal results" as 
fairness. I perceive of equal results through redistribution as the true 
unfairness. I do not worry about how much money the Clinton's have. What I 
worry about is if they got it honestly, or through some form of corruption. 
I don't think Chelsea Clinton's opinion is worth $75,000 a pop, but it 
doesn't matter as long as they do not preach piety and "fair share" like a 
Joe Biden and then give $336 a year in charity.

You and I are not equal. Let us assume you are smarter and better looking. 
You have advantages that I do not think it is the government's job to 
redress! You can use your smarts to make a good life for yourself, or you 
can become a cartel leader and go to prison. You can become a moral 
politician or you can become a crook like Eleanor Holmes Norton. I don't 
think I, nor the government should be making your choices. You have a right 
to succeed, or a right to fail. Conservatives believe in a "safety net", 
not a social net. I had a finance' whose mother was the DSC chairperson for 
the State of Montana. She according to her own unbiased perspective was the 
most righteous person who ever lived. They started a half-way house right 
behind her condo in Helena for Down's Syndrome young adults teaching them 
"life skills" like counting money, shopping, cooking, washing clothes, etc. 
Independence! She was angry about it. I asked why, she said, "Well they 
built it right behind my condo. I said, "Well, you are a Ted Kennedy aren't 
you! Build those windmills over there by the little people, don't build a 
charitable half-way house behind my condo!" She said to me, and I quote, "I 
shouldn't have to look at them!" That is the liberal elite in a nutshell! 
We believe in a safety net, but we don't look down our long noses at the 
people we serve.

And we do not expect your results to be the same as mine. We believe 
government should do their best to make sure I don't cheat you out of your 
equal opportunity.
comments.author: Quasimoto44

comments.text:
Capitalism is most definitely the problem because it epitomizes inequality 
and oppression. What we see now is that capitalism is under siege from its 
own contradictions and the upsurge of socialist ideals. The capitalists 
know that socialism will impinge on their outrageous wealth and thus seek 
ways to defend themselves against the socialists. Fascists tend to espouse 
a simplistic message which is attractive to many people even though they, 
initially, wish to protect the Capitalist status quo. For that reason, many 
current openly fascist/nazi parties are being supported by rich 
industrialists. We saw this happen in 1930s Germany and now in Greece.

Corruption itself is intimitely bound up with the Capitalist system. You've 
read Marx so you should be familiar with the way Capitalists usually try to 
reduce wages and other benefits. If corruption is the way they can achieve 
their goals (and other goals like the ones you mentioned) then it is only 
normal, within that system, that they use these goals. I have no doubt that 
Capitalists have entire analyses on how much money they need to spend to 
get what and how profitable this approach will be.
comments.author: Hadrian Ferran
